ZetaFish.GUI
Class GamePanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  ZetaFish.GUI.GamePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, ICardButtonPush, ICardRequestResponseListener, IChatListener, IRemovePlayerListener, IStatusListener, ITurnListener
public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IStatusListener, ITurnListener, ICardRequestResponseListener, IChatListener, IRemovePlayerListener, ICardButtonPush, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.lang.Runnable

Summary: Class GamePanel represents the playing area that houses 3 sections. It holds the player, opponent, and pool panels. This is where the user can see what is happening during the game. Mainly, it can give an intuitive feeling of how many cards are left in the deck and what is in the player's hand.

See Also:
Serialized Form
